alert.note: Alert for Eddy (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued February 26 at 3:20PM MST until February 26 at 4:15PM MST by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Midland has issued a * Dust Storm Warning for... Western Eddy County in southeastern New Mexico... Northwestern Culberson County in southwestern Texas... * Until 515 PM CST/415 PM MST/. * At 417 PM CST/317 PM MST/, a dust channel was over Carlsbad and Arteisa, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Less than a quarter mile visibility with damaging wind in excess of 60 mph. SOURCE...Public. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes the following highways... Highway 285 between Artesia and Carlsbad Highway 82 between Hope and Artesia Highway 62 between Carlsbad and Pine Springs Locations impacted include... Carlsbad, Artesia, Hope, Pine Springs, McKittrick Canyon, Avalon, Seven Rivers Airport, Brantley Lake State Park, Carlsbad North, Guadalupe Mountains National Park, Carlsbad Caverns National Park, Whites City, Lincoln National Forest, Queen, Artesia Municipal Airport, Cavern City Air Terminal, Living Desert State Park, Dayton, Lakewood and Atoka. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
